FuncDef: The display mpls sr-te cspf destination command displays information about paths that satisfy specified constraints. The constraints are specified using parameters.
CLIs: display mpls sr-te cspf destination <ip-address> [ metric-type { igp | te } | srlg-strict <exclude-path-name> | explicit-path <pri-path-name> | affinity { <pri-properties> [ mask <pri-mask-value> ] | { { include-all | include-any } { <pri-in-name-string> } &<1-32> | exclude { <pri-ex-name-string> } &<1-32> } * } | hop-limit <pri-hop-limit-number> | adjacency-sid ] * [ hot-standby [ explicit-path <hsb-path-name> | overlap-path | affinity { <hsb-properties> [ mask <hsb-mask-value> ] | { { hsb-include-all | hsb-include-any } { <hsb-in-name-string> } &<1-32> | hsb-exclude { <hsb-ex-name-string> } &<1-32> } * } | hop-limit <hsb-hop-limit-number> | srlg { strict | preferred } ] * ] [ path-verify ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the destination IP address of a tunnel.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Indicates the metric constraint.
-

Indicates the IGP metric constraint.
-

Indicates the TE metric constraint.
-

Specifies the name of a path based on an SRLG.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of an explicit path.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of an explicit path over which a hot-standby LSP is established.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the affinity name of a primary LSP.
The value ranges from 0 to ffffffff, in hexadecimal notation. The default value is 0.

Specifies the affinity name of a hot-standby LSP.
The value ranges from 0 to ffffffff, in hexadecimal notation. The default value is 0.

Specifies the mask of an affinity.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask of an affinity of a hot-standby LSP.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Allows CSPF to include a link when calculating a path, only if each link administrative group bit has the same name as each affinity bit.
-

Allows CSPF to include a link when calculating a path, if at least one link administrative group bit has the same name as an affinity bit.
-

Specifies a name of an included affinity.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Allows CSPF to exclude a link when calculating a path, if any link administrative group bit has the same name as an affinity bit.
-

Specifies a name of an excluded affinity.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the number of hops on a path.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.

Specifies the maximum number of hops on a path over which a hot-standby LSP is established.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.

Indicates the adjacency SID constraint.
-

Indicates a hot-standby path.
-

Indicates that a hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.
-

Allows CSPF to include a link when calculating a hot-standby LSP, only if each link administrative group bit has the same name as each affinity bit.
-

Allows CSPF to include a link when calculating a hot-standby LSP, if at least one link administrative group bit has the same name as an affinity bit.
-

Specifies a name of an included affinity of a hot-standby LSP.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Allows CSPF to exclude a link when calculating a hot-standby LSP, if any link administrative group bit has the same name as an affinity bit.
-

Specifies a name of an excluded affinity of a hot-standby LSP.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the SRLG attribute.
-

Indicates that the links calculated by CSPF for a hot-standby LSP must in a different SRLG from those of the primary LSP.
-

Preferentially selects the SRLG attribute as an optional constraint used by CSPF to calculate a path for a hot-standby LSP. If CSPF fails to calculate a path for a hot-standby CR-LSP based on the SRLG attribute, CSPF recalculates the path, regardless of the SRLG attribute.
-

Specify path verification.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] display mpls sr-te cspf destination 3.3.3.3 explicit-path abc adjacency-sid path-verify
Path for the given constraints is:
The total metrics of the calculated path is :   20
[~HUAWEI] display mpls sr-te cspf destination 3.3.3.3 explicit-path abc adjacency-sid path-verify
Path for the given constraints is:
The total metrics of the calculated path is :   20
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To display information about paths that satisfy specified constraints between the specified ingress and egress, run the display mpls sr-te cspf destination command.
